description: Career development, interviews, and professional skills

topics.title: Resume & Portfolio

definition.text: A strong technical resume and portfolio showcase your skills, projects, and achievements. They're your first impression and determine whether you get an interview.

keyFormulas.name: Strong Bullet Formula
keyFormulas.formula: Action Verb + Technology + Impact with Metrics
keyFormulas.meaning: Specific achievements are more impactful than generic descriptions

examples.question: Write a strong resume bullet point

steps.result: Developed, Built, Optimized
Developed React dashboard
...reducing reporting time by 60%

examples.finalAnswer: Developed React dashboard with real-time analytics, reducing reporting time by 60% for 50+ stakeholders

realWorldApplications.title: Job Applications
realWorldApplications.description: Get past ATS and into interviews

tips: Quantify everything: time saved, money made, users affected
Tailor your resume for each job application
Keep it to 1 page for <10 years experience

topics.title: GitHub Portfolio

definition.text: Your GitHub profile is often reviewed by recruiters and hiring managers. A well-maintained GitHub demonstrates your coding abilities, collaboration skills, and passion for development.

keyFormulas.name: Project README Checklist
keyFormulas.formula: Title + Description + Screenshot + Tech Stack + Setup + Usage + License

examples.question: Create a project README

steps.result:
# Project Name
![Build Status](badge)

## Overview
![Screenshot](image.png)

## Installation
```bash
npm install
```

examples.finalAnswer: Complete README that helps users understand and use your project

tips: Pin your 6 best repositories
Add a profile README (username/username repo)
Quality over quantity - clean up old/messy repos

topics.title: Technical Interviews

definition.text: Technical interviews assess your coding abilities, problem-solving skills, and technical knowledge. Preparation and practice are key to success.

keyFormulas.name: Problem-Solving Framework
keyFormulas.formula: 1. Understand â†’ 2. Plan â†’ 3. Code â†’ 4. Test â†’ 5. Analyze (Big O)
keyFormulas.meaning: Process matters as much as the answer

examples.question: How to approach a coding interview question

steps.result: Ask: 'Can I assume the input is always valid?'
I'll use a hash map for O(n) lookup
Clean, readable code with comments
Walk through with sample input

tips: Practice 2-3 problems daily for consistency
Focus on patterns, not memorizing solutions
Always analyze time and space complexity

topics.title: Behavioral Interviews

definition.text: Behavioral interviews assess how you've handled past situations. The STAR method (Situation, Task, Action, Result) helps structure your responses effectively.

keyFormulas.name: STAR Method
keyFormulas.formula: Situation (context) + Task (responsibility) + Action (what YOU did) + Result (outcome with metrics)
keyFormulas.meaning: Structured stories are more memorable and convincing

examples.question: Tell me about a time you solved a difficult problem

steps.result: Our API was experiencing 5-second response times during peak hours
As the senior developer, I was tasked with improving performance
I profiled the code, identified N+1 queries, and implemented caching
Response times dropped to 200ms, improving user satisfaction by 40%

examples.finalAnswer: Complete STAR response with specific actions and measurable results

realWorldApplications.title: Self-reflection
realWorldApplications.description: Identify your strengths and growth areas

tips: Prepare 5-6 stories that cover common themes
Always end with positive results
Practice telling stories in 2 minutes or less

topics.title: Technical Communication

definition.text: Technical communication is the ability to explain complex concepts clearly. It's essential for code reviews, documentation, presentations, and collaborating with non-technical stakeholders.

keyFormulas.name: Audience-First Communication
keyFormulas.formula: Who (audience) + What (concept) + Why (relevance) + How (details at right level)
keyFormulas.meaning: Tailor your message to your audience

examples.question: Explain a technical concept to a non-technical person

steps.result: An API is like a waiter in a restaurant
It takes your order to the kitchen and brings back your food
This is how our app gets data from the server

examples.finalAnswer: Clear explanation using analogy and connecting to context

tips: Use analogies to explain complex concepts
Ask questions to confirm understanding
Write documentation as if you'll forget everything tomorrow

topics.title: System Design Interviews

definition.text: System design interviews assess your ability to design large-scale distributed systems. They test your knowledge of architecture patterns, trade-offs, and ability to communicate complex designs clearly.

keyFormulas.name: Design Interview Framework
keyFormulas.formula: 1. Requirements (5min) â†’ 2. High-Level Design (10min) â†’ 3. Deep Dive (20min) â†’ 4. Trade-offs (5min)
keyFormulas.meaning: Structured approach shows you can organize complex problems

keyFormulas.name: Back-of-Envelope Calculations
keyFormulas.formula:
DAU Ã— Actions/User Ã— Data/Action = Daily Volume
Volume Ã· 86,400 = Requests/Second
keyFormulas.meaning: Quick math to validate design decisions

examples.question: Design Twitter's timeline feature

steps.result: 500M users, 200M DAU, avg 50 tweets read/day
10B reads/day = 115K reads/second
Fan-out on write vs read trade-off
Celebrities: fan-out on read
steps.explanation: Hybrid approach for users with millions of followers

examples.finalAnswer: Hybrid fan-out approach with caching and sharding

codeExample.text:
# System Design Template

## 1. Requirements & Constraints
- Functional requirements (features)
- Non-functional requirements (scale, latency)
- Assumptions and constraints

## 2. Capacity Estimation
- Users: DAU, concurrent users
- Traffic: requests/second, read/write ratio
- Storage: data per user, retention period
- Bandwidth: data in/out per second

## 3. High-Level Design
- Major components and data flow
- API design (REST endpoints)
- Database schema

## 4. Detailed Design
- Deep dive on critical components
- Scaling strategies
- Data partitioning

## 5. Trade-offs & Bottlenecks
- Single points of failure
- Potential bottlenecks
- Consistency vs availability

tips: Always start with requirements - don't jump to design
Draw diagrams as you explain
Discuss trade-offs, not just one solution
Know numbers: network latency, disk I/O, memory bandwidth

topics.title: Salary Negotiation

definition.text: Salary negotiation is the process of discussing compensation to reach a mutually acceptable agreement. Engineers often leave money on the table by not negotiating effectively.

keyFormulas.name: Total Compensation
keyFormulas.formula: Base Salary + Bonus + Equity/Stock + Benefits + Signing Bonus
keyFormulas.meaning: Compare offers on total compensation, not just base salary

keyFormulas.name: Negotiation Leverage
keyFormulas.formula: Multiple Offers + Market Research + Unique Skills = Leverage

examples.question: Negotiate a job offer effectively

steps.result: levels.fyi, Glassdoor, Blind
Full offer letter with all details
I'm excited about this role. Based on my research...
If base is fixed, ask about signing bonus or equity

examples.finalAnswer: Prepare, be confident, and negotiate the entire package

realWorldApplications.title: Career Growth
realWorldApplications.description: Compound effect of higher starting salary

tips: Never give a number first if you can avoid it
Get competing offers if possible
Be willing to walk away
Negotiate in writing for complex discussions

topics.title: Engineering Leadership

definition.text: Engineering leadership involves guiding teams, making technical decisions, and aligning engineering work with business goals. It requires both technical expertise and people skills.

keyFormulas.name: Leadership Evolution
keyFormulas.formula: IC (do work) â†’ Tech Lead (guide work) â†’ Manager (enable work) â†’ Director (define work)
keyFormulas.meaning: Leadership evolves from doing to enabling

keyFormulas.name: Delegation Framework
keyFormulas.formula: Context + Clear Expectations + Support + Accountability = Effective Delegation
keyFormulas.meaning: Delegate effectively to grow your team

examples.question: How to be an effective tech lead

steps.result: Define architecture, standards, and best practices
Clear dependencies, make decisions, remove obstacles
steps.explanation: Your job is to enable others

steps.result: Stay hands-on but don't become a bottleneck
steps.explanation: Touch code but don't hoard it

steps.result: Code reviews as teaching moments
steps.explanation: Raise the bar for the whole team

examples.finalAnswer: Tech leads multiply team impact through guidance and enablement

realWorldApplications.title: Career Progression
realWorldApplications.description: Path to director and VP roles

tips: Your success is measured by team success, not personal output
Regular 1:1s are crucial - never skip them
Give feedback early and often
Protect your team from unnecessary distractions

topics.title: Staff+ Engineering

definition.text: Staff+ engineers (Staff, Principal, Distinguished) are senior individual contributors who drive technical strategy across teams or organizations. They combine deep technical expertise with broad organizational impact.

keyFormulas.name: Staff+ Impact Model
keyFormulas.formula: Personal Impact Ã— Team Multiplier Ã— Org Multiplier = Total Impact
keyFormulas.meaning: Staff+ engineers multiply impact across the organization

keyFormulas.name: Influence Without Authority
keyFormulas.meaning: Lead through expertise and trust, not title

examples.question: Lead a company-wide technical initiative

steps.result: Technical debt slowing all teams
Align with eng leads and stakeholders
Propose migration strategy with phases
Quick wins first, then bigger changes
steps.explanation: Prove value early to maintain momentum

steps.result: Teams own new patterns going forward

examples.finalAnswer: Drive change through influence, documentation, and incremental wins

realWorldApplications.title: Architecture
realWorldApplications.description: Design systems that span multiple teams

codeExample.markdown:
# RFC: Migrate to Service Mesh

## Summary
Proposal to adopt Istio service mesh for all microservices.

## Problem Statement
- Inconsistent observability across 50+ services
- Manual mTLS configuration error-prone
- No circuit breaker standardization

## Proposed Solution
Phased rollout of Istio across all clusters.

### Phase 1 (Q1): Non-prod environments
### Phase 2 (Q2): Canary production services
### Phase 3 (Q3): Full production rollout

## Trade-offs
- âœ… Unified observability and security
- âš ï¸ Learning curve for teams
- âš ï¸ Increased operational complexity

## Alternatives Considered
- Linkerd: Simpler but fewer features
- DIY: Already tried, inconsistent results

## Success Metrics
- 100% mTLS coverage
- <10ms P99 latency overhead
- All services with distributed tracing

tips: Pick problems that matter to the business
Write things down - documentation creates alignment
Build relationships across teams before you need them
Sponsor and mentor rising engineers
Stay technical - your credibility depends on it

topics.title: Career Growth Strategy

definition.text: Strategic career growth involves intentionally developing skills, building relationships, and positioning yourself for opportunities. It requires understanding both the technical and political landscape of your organization.

keyFormulas.name: Career Growth Equation
keyFormulas.meaning: Great work alone isn't enough - it must be visible

keyFormulas.name: Promotion Evidence
keyFormulas.formula: Impact (scope Ã— depth) + Leadership (people Ã— projects) + Consistency (time Ã— reviews)
keyFormulas.meaning: Build an undeniable case for promotion

examples.question: Get promoted to senior engineer

steps.result: Read level expectations, talk to seniors
steps.explanation: Know what's expected at the next level

steps.result: Self-assess against criteria
Volunteer for visible, challenging work
Document impact continuously
steps.explanation: Don't rely on memory at review time

steps.result: Find someone who advocates for you

examples.finalAnswer: Strategic, documented approach to career advancement

tips: Your manager can't remember everything - document your wins
Mentors advise, sponsors advocate - you need both
Visibility without substance is empty, substance without visibility is invisible
Timing matters - be ready when opportunities arise
Network internally and externally
